channel.title: Mammals on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Mammals on ZooBerry

item.title: AGP - Armored Rhino
item.description: A mysterious armored rhino creature has been discovered in the lab, with no sign of Dr. Ricad.

item.title: AGP - Cotton the White Elephant
item.description: A genetically modified white elephant, affectionately named Cotton, was discovered in the abandoned Dr. Ricad’s Lab.

item.title: AGP - Fast Sheep
item.description: A genetically modified sheep discovered in Dr. Ricad’s Lab, providing key evidence in the mystery of Dr. Ricad’s disappearance.

item.title: AGP - Hulk the Wolf
item.description: A powerful genetically modified wolf, named The Hulk, was discovered in the lab trying to escape its cage.

item.title: Beaver
item.description: The beaver is a semi-aquatic rodent known for its broad, flat tail and remarkable ability to cut down trees for building lodges and dams.

item.title: Moonwalking Giraffe
item.description: A whimsical giraffe that performs an impressive moonwalk, sure to amuse visitors.

item.title: Parma Wallaby
item.description: The Parma Wallaby (Macropus parma) is a herbivorous marsupial found in Eastern New South Wales, Australia, known for its hopping gait and use of a ‘5-legged’ posture when grazing.

item.title: Party Panda
item.description: A lively panda breed that loves music and dancing, bringing joy and energy to the exhibit.

item.title: Reinhorse
item.description: The Reinhorse is a majestic flying horse that captivates visitors with its grace and beauty.

item.title: Addra Gazelle
item.description: Native to the Sahara Desert, this beautiful antelope once roamed the arid regions of North Africa. With its slender build and striking white and reddish-brown coat, the Addra Gazelle is perfectly adapted to desert life and an ideal addition to your desert or African savannah exhibits.

item.title: African Civet
item.description: Native to sub-Saharan Africa, this large, nocturnal mammal is known for its striking black and white markings. A solitary and elusive creature, the African Civet spends its nights foraging under the cover of darkness. Add this fascinating species to your African exhibit, offering your guests a glimpse into the secretive world of nocturnal wildlife! Mod originally published on Hawkkeye666’s Google Drive and archived with his permission on ZooBerry.

item.title: Abaco Barb
item.description: The Abaco Barb was a rare breed of horse that lived on Great Abaco Island in the Bahamas. It was known for its hardiness and small stature, standing between 13 and 14 hands high, with a muscular build.

item.title: Abbot's Duiker
item.description: Native to the dense forests of Central Africa, this small antelope species is known for its shy nature and unique appearance. This mod brings the Abbot’s Duiker to life with fully animated movements, creating an immersive and realistic experience for your visitors.

item.title: Aberdeen Angus
item.description: Add one of the worldâ€™s most popular beef cattle breeds to your farm-themed exhibits with the Aberdeen Angus! This Scottish breed, originating from Aberdeenshire and Angus counties, is renowned for its hardiness, adaptability, and premium-quality beef.

item.title: Hamadryas Baboon
item.description: Adds the striking and unique looking Hamadryas baboon for adoption.

item.title: Saola
item.description: Adds the rare and elusive Saola for adoption in your zoo.
